item.title: Putting Rsps Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Aragorn7:

I kinda understand now, but I mean do I put my ipv4 address that is portforwarded, my internet IP or my no-ip domain in YOUR IP?

You put the IP found at http://whatismyip.com
Unless you are using no-ip, then you would put that.

Edit: it appears whatismyip has updated their service to IPv6.
http://ip4.me/ has your regular IPv4.

Read full topic

item.title: Putting Rsps Online
item.dc:creator: @HairyNips HairyNips
item.description:
@HairyNips wrote:

Aragorn7:

I kinda understand now, but I mean do I put my ipv4 address that is portforwarded, my internet IP or my no-ip domain in YOUR IP?

You put your NO-IP domain. That is what they are connecting to the server through.

Read full topic

item.title: Putting Rsps Online
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Here’s how it works:
For others to play, they need a client with your ip address in it.
For you to play, you need a client set to localhost if you are on the same computer the RSPS is being hosted on
If you are on the same network but not the same computer, your local IP address should be fine (The one used to port forward).
Otherwise, you use the same IP address as you used for others to connect.

Read full topic

item.title: Putting Rsps Online
item.dc:creator: @Aragorn7 Aragorn7
item.description:
@Aragorn7 wrote:

Hey guys,
I want to put my server online so players can join.

If I go to settings.java I see. public static final String SERVER_IP = “37.187.26.229”;
Do I have to change it to “localhost”, “127.0.0.1”, to my “IP”, (example) Aragorn.no-ip.org or leave it as it is?

And also if I go to loader.java I find
public static String IP = “localhost”;
public static String LOBBY_IP = “localhost”;
public static boolean localHost;

What do I have to change?

Read full topic
